intro: Discospermum fruticosum, commonly known as the prickly gooseberry, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture, while its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry woodlands and scrublands.
